result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren J. Belling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darren J. Belling in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Darren J. Belling in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:30
Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Bednar/Voorhees/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court WHS and POP for 1 year
CC/CV/Supervision fees/DNA surcharge - Submit DNA sample- Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO  - to receive 22 days credit if revoked
Appeal rights given 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

04:33 p.m.Attorney John E Voorhees in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant currently in custody in Marathon county on a $10,000 cash bond.  Voorhees states does not know details of Marathon County case.  Adjournment requested.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Darren J. Belling in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Darren J. Belling in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:47
In receipt, waive reading - not guilty plea
Voorhees statement to bail - Michlig statement - Court statement - Court modifies to $1000 sig bond  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
no intoxicants in any amount in any location, no taverns

01:58 pm - Defendant Darren J. Belling in court,via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
